channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing 2021 launch: John Whaite and Johannes Radebe are the first all-male pairing
item.description: Dusting off their paddles were returning judges Shirley Ballas, 61, Craig Revel Horwood, 56, and Motsi Mabuse, 40, alongside the newest addition to the panel, Anton Du Beke , 55

item.title: CIA issued warning that children were at scene of Kabul drone strike BEFORE missile hit car
item.description: Three sources said the urgent warning came just moments too late - after the military launched the Hellfire missile and just seconds before it struck.

item.title: French minister accuses Britain of returning to the 'American lap'
item.description: Paris reacted with fury after the Australians announced that as a result of the agreement, they were pulling out of a £30billion deal for the French to supply them with a new fleet of submarines.

item.title: US Capitol braces for 'Justice for J6' rally TODAY in support of rioters imprisoned
item.description: A sparsely attended 'Justice for J6' rally featured more police officers and press than protesters as a few hundred demonstrators gathered in the shadow of the Capitol building.

item.title: Vintage fanatics enjoy a day of motor racing at Goodwood Revival
item.description: From beehives and mini-skirts to fabulous furs, retro army uniforms and old-fashioned driving gear, glamorous guests battled it out to be the best dressed on the second day of the Goodwood Revival.

item.title: Visitors enjoy spectacular displays at Duxford's 1940-themed Battle of Britain air show 2021
item.description: Visitors immersed themselves in a day of 1940's-themed action during a spectacular display of historic planes at an RAF site that served a key role in Britain's finest hour - The Battle of Britain.

item.title: How Iran's top nuclear scientist was assassinated by a killer robot machine gun kitted out with AI
item.description: Mohsen Fakhrizadeh, 62, dubbed the 'father' of Iran's illegal atomic program, was ambushed November 27 while driving to his home in Absard, near Tehran.

item.title: Laurene Powell Jobs and daughter Eve are spotted shoe shopping at Dolce & Gabanna in Rome
item.description: Steve Jobs' widow, Laurene, was spotted shopping alongside her daughter while in Rome Saturday, before stepping out for dinner after the 23-year-old finished competing at horse trails.

item.title: Boxer Amir Khan claims claims he was escorted off US flight for 'no reason'
item.description: The 34-year-old, who has also appeared on reality television shows including I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here!, claimed he had been 'banned' by American Airlines.

item.title: COVID UK: Anti-vaxxers march through London protesting government plans to give children Covid jab
item.description: Thousands of anti-vaxxers descended on London on Saturday holding signs reading 'stay away from our kids' and a boy held a card with 'I'm a child, I can't consent'.

item.title: Britons make the most of 75F Saturday weather before two inches of rain brings floods to end weekend
item.description: A skinny dipper was spotted getting out of the water after a refreshing dip in the coastal town of Bournemouth on Saturday, while fellow beach goers soaked up the 75F (24C) sunshine.

item.title: Proof the BBC won't switch off its bias: Broadcaster demands we pay for it and denies it's Left wing
item.description: UK Culture Secretary Nadine Dorries was appointed on the very day the Beeb unveiled one Jess Brammar as its new executive news editor.

item.title: Facebook documents show it hindered Zuckerberg's goal to get 50 million people vaccinated
item.description: For months, Facebook's researches warned that comments on the vaccine-related posts that the platform was promoting were filled with antivaccine rhetoric that hindered Zuckerberg's goal.

item.title: British woman who escaped Malaysia death penalty returns to the UK with 'ring on her wedding finger'
item.description: Samantha Jones, 55, was freed after spending three years in a rat-infested cell in Pokok Sena, Malaysia, and pictured back home at her three-bedroom home near Yeovil wearing a 'ring on her wedding finger'.

item.title: Amateur photographers share VERY funny snaps of animals not looking their best
item.description: The animal kingdom inspires many amateur wildlife photographers to pick up their cameras - but these images prove that some of them don't quite have the natural talent.

item.title: Heartwarming photos of older couples prove that age is no barrier to romance
item.description: Shareably has rounded up a selection of viral photos from around the world that show older couples in love - including a husband in the U.S, doing his wife's hair after she had surgery on her wrist.

item.title: Afghanistan's last Jew set to travel to America after fleeing over fears that ISIS-K will kill him
item.description: Zebulon Simantov, 62, had initially refused to leave Afghanistan, despite the Taliban's complete takeover, but was convinced to leave with a rescue team.

item.title: Greece opens new holding camp to house 3,000 migrants as it prepares for a wave of Afghan refugees
item.description: Campaigners have criticised the new reception and identification centre for migrants in Samos, Greece and said its barbed wire fencing and heavy security presence is akin to a prison facility.

item.title: Gavin Williamson is 'tipped for a KNIGHTHOOD' after being sacked as Education Secretary
item.description: Gavin Williamson, who has also served as defence secretary, is set to appear on the Prime Minister's honours list, according to reports.

item.title: Strictly is left in crisis as two professional dancers refuse Covid jabs
item.description: The pair are reportedly the only two pro dancers out of 18 who have not been vaccinated for the BBC hit show, which is hosted by Claudia Winkelman and Tess Daly.

item.title: Pictured: Man, 46, whose body was found dumped in London three weeks after he vanished in Reading
item.description: Duane Denny went missing from his home in Reading on August 24 but the investigation switched to Erith, London, after a body was found on Thursday.

item.title: Obama told Trump he couldn't recall his 'biggest mistakes' in the White House, new book claims
item.description: New book Peril shared an alleged conversation between former President Barack Obama and Donald Trump on the way to the Capitol in 2017.

item.title: Russia claims its parliamentary elections have been hit by 'targeted attacks from abroad'
item.description: Russia's Communist Party head has accused Putin's supporters of ballot stuffing, trying to vote several times in one place or at multiple polling stations, during the three-day parliamentary vote.

item.title: Liam Gallagher suffers a nasty facial injury after falling out of a helicopter in Isle of Wight
item.description: Liam Gallagher shocked fans on Saturday when he tweeted that he had fallen out of a helicopter following his gig at the Isle of Wight Festival the previous night.

item.title: Police launch urgent search for missing teenage sisters, 13 and 15, after they vanished in London
item.description: Maria, 13, and Aisha, 15, disappeared from Roehampton last night. It is believed they are together and could be travelling through central London on buses.

item.title: Business Secretary claims Britain will avoid energy emergency after Russia accused of rigging prices
item.description: Kwasi Kwarteng said he did 'not expect supply emergencies this winter' as he prepared for talks with chief executives of the UK's largest energy suppliers to discuss the global gas situation today.

item.title: Adele enjoys a low-key date night with her boyfriend Rich Paul at In-N-Out
item.description: Adele opted out of the prestigious Met Gala this year in favour of a low-key burger date at In-N-Out with her boyfriend Rich Paul on Monday night.

item.title: Son claims mum left paralysed after getting stuck for SIX HOURS on the M25 because of eco-mob
item.description: A man, who gave his name as Chris, told LBC's Andrew Pierce about his mother's predicament, adding that he 'could do nothing' - although the caller's claim is as yet unsubstantiated.

item.title: Diamonds used for Meghan's earrings were 'gifted from the Middle East'
item.description: Interest in the jewellery continues to overshadow the Duchess of Sussex's appearance on the cover of Time magazine earlier this week.

item.title: Study: habitual marijuana users - including teenagers - are being hit with 'uncontrollable vomiting'
item.description: Emergency rooms across the US are seeing an influx in habitual marijuana users - including teenagers - being admitted for uncontrollable vomiting and intestinal distress, a new study reveals.

item.title: Pippa Middleton pictured for first time since brother James' wedding on walk in Chelsea, west London
item.description: The Duchess of Cambridge's 38-year-old sister basked in the late September sun as she was seen on a brief stroll near her home in Chelsea, west London.

item.title: Girl, two, dies after falling from pony she was riding with hunt in Yorkshire
item.description: The toddler tragically fell as she joined members of The Bedale Hunt (pictured, the venue) at the gathering on Wednesday.

item.title: 'My life stopped the day he disappeared': Father of missing RAF gunner Corrie McKeague, 23
item.description: Thursday would have been the 28th birthday of the RAF gunner Corrie McKeague who went missing during a night out in Bury St Edmunds in the early hours of September 24, 2016.

item.title: Boris Johnson slammed by US Congress members over amnesty proposal for Northern Ireland Troubles
item.description: 36 members of the US Congress have written to Boris Johnson urging him to scrap plans for amnesty proposals that would stop future prosecutions that relate to the Northern Ireland Troubles.

item.title: Bodyguard 'confirmed for season two with Richard Madden'
item.description: The Sun reports that now Jed has finished writing Line of Duty season six and Richard has completed filming the Marvel superhero film Eternals, the pair can work on the follow up together.

item.title: Daniel Craig bids farewell to James Bond role as he delivers emotional speech
item.description: Daniel Craig bid farewell to his role as James Bond, and the cast and crew he got to know along the way, in an emotional video shared to Twitter on Friday.

item.title: Christmas toy shortage fears as retailers say time it takes to ship stock from Far East has DOUBLED
item.description: British giants like John Lewis have chartered extra ships in a bid to secure more products while high street favourites like Waterstones have ordered more stock than usual to get ahead of the crunch.

item.title: France stops two-thirds more migrants boats after Priti Patel's threat to cut off funding
item.description: A total of 1,177 migrant crossings to Britain were halted in the ten days after Priti Patel warned that the UK was considering pulling £54million in funding, while 1,115 made it across.

item.title: Sarah Palin goes on bizarre rant: she has NOT had the vaccine because she 'believes in the science'
item.description: Sarah Palin, 57, revealed that she has not received the COVID vaccine explaining on a Fox News talk show, 'I believe in the science and I have not taken the shot,' claiming she has natural immunity.

item.title: UK faces being crippled by 'perfect storm' of Covid, Brexit and soaring gas prices
item.description: Britain is facing up to a bleak end to the year, with a fresh threat of food shortages coming amid an imminent hike in the cost of living.

item.title: Notre Dame is finally declared stable enough for repairs to begin
item.description: The French government agency overseeing the reconstruction announced that work to secure the famous Paris structure - which began the day after the fire on April 15, 2019 - is at last complete.

item.title: Travel rules shake-up sparks half-term booking frenzy
item.description: Transport Secretary Grant Shapps announced on Friday that the traffic light system is to be replaced from October 4 by a single, reduced, 'red list' of destinations.

item.title: Coronavirus infections rise by just 2% in a week to 30,144 and deaths go up by eight to 164
item.description: Department of Health bosses posted 30,144 new cases today, up two per cent on the 29,547 recorded last Saturday. The number of people dying also increased 5.1 per cent to 164.

item.title: Beautiful in black! Queen Letizia of Spain channels rock chick style in a leather belted dress
item.description: The royal mother-of-two, 49, sported the £298 belted frock from & Other Stories when attending the Famelab 2021 final in Madrid, which is an international scientific talks competition.

item.title: Shocking photos of NYC's Hooverville homeless encampments in Central Park during Great Depression
item.description: Remembering the time homeless encampments known as 'Hoovervilles' took over Central Park during the Great Depression.

item.title: Investigation begins to find origin of case of mad cow disease identified on Somerset farm
item.description: The Animal and Plant Health Agency will launch a 'thorough investigation' after a case of mad cow disease was identified on an unnamed farm in Somerset on Friday.

item.title: Apple and Google under fire for political meddling as they both remove Navalny's app under pressure
item.description: Allies of opposition leader Alexei Navalny, President Vladimir Putin's fiercest domestic opponent, planned to use the mobile app to organise a tactical voting campaign to deal a blow to United Russia.

item.title: Strictly's Giovanni Pernice shares video of celebrity partner's bruised and battered feet
item.description: Strictly Come Dancing 2021 will premiere on Saturday night, revealing the professional dancers and their celebrity partners.

item.title: Kester Black founder reveals how she turned a hobby into a $20million beauty brand
item.description: Anna Ross grew up in a town of just 64 people in the New Zealand city of Dunedin and is the mastermind behind vegan and cruelty-free beauty brand Kester Black.

item.title: Boy, nine, killed after being hit by white van in horror hit-and-run crash - as man, 49, arrested
item.description: A man, 49, was arrested after the child was hit by a van shortly after 9.30pm on Sutton Lane in West Yorkshire on Friday night. The boy had been pronounced dead at the scene.

item.title: British schoolgirl, 16, 'incredibly unlucky' to collapse and die from undiagnosed heart condition
item.description: Aspiring counsellor Apryl Scorer, 16, was relaxing on the south coast of France with her family at a campsite they had visited every summer for years when she collapsed and died.

item.title: Biden to begin 'deportation blitz' to Haiti by Sunday and restart the repatriation trips he ended
item.description: Department of Homeland Security officials are planning as many as eight flights per day to Haiti, starting on Sunday, about a week since President Joe Biden cancelled repatriation flights to Haiti.

item.title: Ex Corrie star Craig Charles, 57, reveals he has Covid and his 'breathing is laboured'
item.description: The TV star turned DJ, 57, - who played Lloyd Mullaney on the ITV soap - told how he was 'sorry to let everyone down' ahead of starting his new job at BBC Radio 6 Music.

item.title: Dating expert reveals the mistakes that YOU could me making on a first date
item.description: UK-based dating expert, Kate Taylor, has looked at new survey data from Ourtime to investigate what mistakes singles are making on a first date that could be costing them their chance at love.

item.title: The dangerous beauty techniques you should ALWAYS avoid
item.description: Speaking to FEMAIL three UK leading experts in the beauty industry revealed how to make sure you go to the right technicians.

item.title: Amelia Hamlin, Joanne Froggatt and Jaime Winstone put on a showstopping display at the Icon Ball
item.description: The Loose Women star, 50, and the rocker, 76, looked like they were having a great time at the at the inaugural event, which was organised to raise money for NHS Charities.

item.title: Little Mix's joint company boasts huge £6M fortune despite Jesy Nelson's exit from the band
item.description: On Friday the pop girl band filed their accounts for the business they set up in October 2011 to look after their earnings from the group.

item.title: Taliban excludes girls from returning to secondary school
item.description: The Taliban swept to power last month promising a softer brand of rule than their repressive reign in the 1990s, when women were mostly banned from education and work.

item.title: Father in New Zealand cries 'is this really happening?' after finding three daughters dead
item.description: Orthopaedic surgeon Graham Dickason 'wailed' after finding two-year-old twins Karla and Maya and their older sister Liane, six, dead at their home in Timaru. His wife Lauren, 40, is accused of murder.

item.title: Russian 'Bazooka' bodybuilder warned he could die unless he has huge fake bicep implants removed
item.description: GRAPHIC CONTENT: Ex-Russian solider Kirill Tereshin, 25, faces the prospect of losing his arms or even death after he injected 6L of petroleum jelly into himself to create artificially huge biceps.

item.title: Phones 4U founder John Caudwell reveals details of horror Italy crash when his front tyre EXPLODED
item.description: Billionaire tycoon John Caudwell, 68, was left unable to breathe and in agonising pain after his horror crash in the mountains of Florence, Italy during a holiday from hell earlier this summer.

item.title: The Holiday Guru tackles readers' Covid-related travel issues, including a testing fiasco in Kos
item.description: The Holiday Guru is always on hand to answer your questions. And with the pandemic causing mass confusion among travellers, the Guru's advice has never been more sought-after.

item.title: Minnie Driver dons a wetsuit, a swimming cap as she takes part in Children With Cancer UK
item.description: Minnie Driver donned a wetsuit and a swimming cap for the Children With Cancer UK swim in the Serpentine in London on Saturday morning.

item.title: House of the Dragon SPOILER: Matt Smith's Prince Daemon Targaryen appears to be DEAD on shore
item.description: On Thursday, actor Matt Smith, 38, was pictured as Prince Daemon Targaryen on the set of the highly anticipated fantasy drama series on a beach in Cornwall.

item.title: Man dies in explosion while setting off fireworks in Tasmania
item.description: The man was struck in the chest and shoulder during the blast at a property in Tasmania on Friday night.

item.title: Video: Armed officers confront gunman who pointed weapon at policeman's face
item.description: Sergeant Tony Webb, of West Midlands Police, was responding to reports of a disturbance in Erdington, Birmingham, when he saw a man grabbing a woman by the neck then throwing her to the floor.

item.title: Video: Armed officers confront gunman who pointed weapon at policeman's face
item.description: Sergeant Tony Webb, of West Midlands Police, was responding to reports of a disturbance in Erdington, Birmingham, when he saw a man grabbing a woman by the neck then throwing her to the floor.

item.title: How just TEN people in Britain knew about AUKUS submarine deal
item.description: Boris Johnson, President Joe Biden and Australian prime minister Scott Morrison announced the new pact on Wednesday night, provoking uproar from China and France.

item.title: Pele posts from hospital to assure fans he's 'continuing to smile' and 'recovering very well'
item.description: Brazil football legend Pele has revealed he is very well despite 'a little step back' this week in his recovery after surgery to remove a tumour from his colon earlier this month.

item.title: Tennis player Jamie Murray talks about his travels, including his love for New York
item.description: This week tennis player Jamie Murray checks in to our travel Q&A. He talks about his earliest holiday memory, his favourite Scottish trips and why New York is the best place to play tennis.

item.title: Covid-19 Australia: Gigantic Signs owner bans vaccinated shoppers from his store
item.description: An Adelaide store owner has sparked outrage after raising an anti-vaccination sign on his storefront window. The sign says the store will not accept jabbed customers.

item.title: Birmingham hotel review: Inside High Field Town House in Edgbaston
item.description: The Inspector checked into High Field Town House in Edgbaston. He liked his 'bright and cheerful' bedroom. But he was underwhelmed with his burger at dinner, as well as the breakfast offering.

item.title: Sweden's Princess Victoria and her family join Norway's royals in Gotland
item.description: The heir to the Swedish throne, 44, holidayed with her husband Prince Daniel, 48, and their two children, Princess Estelle, nine, and Prince Oscar, five.

item.title: Under-pressure police chiefs could try to slap M25 eco mob with conspiracy charges
item.description: Police chiefs came under intense pressure for the way they tackled the Insulate Britain protests and could now slap activists with conspiracy charges.

item.title: Government adviser admits Covid vaccine would NOT have been recommended for children in normal times
item.description: Professor Adam Finn, a member of the JCVI said parents were justified in waiting an extra three to six months to get their children jabbed until the risks were made clearer with further research.

item.title: Woman bans her parents from her wedding after a 14-year grudge over a dog
item.description: A British woman, 23, now living in LA, anonymously posted on the popular Reddit forum 'Am I The A******', asking whether she was the one in the wrong for hanging on to the grudge.

item.title: Noel Fitzpatrick breaks down as he pays tribute to his dog Keira, who passed away
item.description: Supervet Noel Fitzpatrick paid a heartfelt tribute to his beloved terrier dog Keira, who passed away last week. The Irish TV vet understandably wiped away tears as he reflected on her nearly 14 years.

item.title: Shameless drug dealer who danced wielding a knife in nightclub video is jailed for six years
item.description: Police were alerted to Snapchat videos of Abel Buafo, 23, at a nightclub in Enfield, on December 22, 2019, where he recorded himself 'selfie-style' waving a black folding knife around the venue.

item.title: The Dutch are still the world's tallest people with the average man hitting 6ft, study finds
item.description: Dutch people born in 2001 are shorter than those born in 1980, a study by the country's statistics office has found.

item.title: People reveal the things they would've done differently on their wedding day
item.description: Facebook users from around the UK took to the Family Lowdown Tips & Ideas group to confess things they would change , including Hollie Marie Smith who wished she'd bought a second dress.

item.title: Covid-19 Australia: Anti-lockdown protests erupt in Melbourne and Sydney
item.description: Anti-lockdown protests erupted across Australia with demonstrators shutting down streets in Melbourne and protestors using an app to navigate around Sydney roadblocks.

item.title: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: So what DID Carrie tell pals about the Royals?
item.description: EDEN CONFIDENTIAL: How fortunate for Boris Johnson's ambitious wife, Carrie, that she has already had her long-awaited stay with the Queen.

item.title: Prince Philip's children and grandchildren share their memories with the Mail's Robert Hardman
item.description: Coming to BBC One on Wednesday night, Prince Philip: The Royal Family Remembers includes contributions from more members of the Royal Family than any programme ever made.

item.title: Cat lovers share pictures of their feline friends being unintentionally hilarious
item.description: Among the snaps taken by owners from around the world, collated by Bored Panda, is a rather undignified ginger cat sitting in a small basket, with fur sticking out of the heart-shaped holes.

item.title: Cat lovers share pictures of their feline friends being unintentionally hilarious
item.description: Among the snaps taken by owners from around the world, collated by Bored Panda, is a rather undignified ginger cat sitting in a small basket, with fur sticking out of the heart-shaped holes.

item.title: BBC pays 'six-figure' damages to Tiggy Legge-Bourke
item.description: Tiggy Legge-Bourke has been offered six-figure damages from the BBC over false claims made by Martin Bashir to obtain his Panorama interview with Princess Diana in 1995.

item.title: Government holds crisis talks after soaring gas prices spark food shortage fears
item.description: High global demand, maintenance issues and lower solar and wind energy output have all been blamed on the increased cost, which has forced much of the UK's CO2 production to stop.

item.title: Property battle of the Nobel Prize winners on Zoopla
item.description: We pick two houses with blue plaques and ask which would you prefer to live in - one where Sir Austen Chamberlain was born or the other where Indian writer Rabindranath Tagore lived?

item.title: Prince Charles' last words to Prince Philip on the eve of his death
item.description: Prince Charles has revealed how he called his father at Windsor the day before he died about planning his 100th birthday and got a vintage Prince Philip response.

item.title: RV with a makeshift second story added on top provokes anger in Seattle
item.description: Residents of the Ballard neighborhood first noticed construction of the rustic second story last week, and fear that it could topple on a passing car or a pedestrian.

item.title: Mass graves with remains of 25 Crusaders slaughtered during a 13th century war are found in Lebanon
item.description: A pair of mass grave with remains of 25 Crusaders who died in the 13th century was found in Lebanon. The remains suggest the men were beheaded and their bodies burned.

item.title: Climate change: Coral reef cover has been decimated by HALF since the 1950s
item.description: The first comprehensive, global look at the effect of pressures like climate change on reef ecosystem services has been conducted by researchers led from the University of British Columbia.

item.title: Los Angeles is hit by magnitude 4.3 earthquake - the second tremor to rock city in a week
item.description: The magnitude-4.3 quake struck shortly after 7:58 p.m. and was centered near Carson, about 21 miles (34 kilometers) southeast of downtown LA.

item.title: Terrifying moment woman finds a confronting 'tree snake orgy' in the laundry of her Townsville home
item.description: Kylie Coates shared a video to Facebook on Thursday of at least four tree snakes in her home in the coastal suburb of Bluewater in Townsville, Queensland.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... Sir Clive Sinclair dying
item.description: PAUL THOMAS: 'It's what he would have wanted.'

item.title: PLATELL'S PEOPLE: Stop hiding, Andrew, and fight off US sex charges
item.description: PLATELL'S PEOPLE: The helicopter hero who flew so bravely in the Falklands is reduced to 'playing hide and seek behind palace walls' according to U.S. lawyers.

item.title: 'Impatient' Tesla driver wrongly arrested after crossing guard falsely claimed drove car into her
item.description: Police arrested Joe Hernandez last week after a crossing guard said the driver hit her with his car but a neighbor's security camera footage shows she lied and all charges have been dropped.

item.title: Two of California Gov Gavin Newsom's children test positive for COVID after survived recall effort
item.description: The couple have four kids - Montana, 12; Hunter, 10; Brooklyn, 8; and Dutch, 5. It was not confirmed which two came down with the virus or if Montana is vaccinated.

item.title: Countdown to death: Minute by minute, how the Pentagon killed innocent aid worker and seven kids
item.description: A detailed timeline released by the Pentagon on Friday, when compared against prior reporting on how aid worker Zemari Ahmadi spent his day on August 29, reveals sequence of events.

item.title: 'True story' claimed to have inspired 12 Angry Men is revealed as a work of pure fiction
item.description: Research conducted by Professor Phil Rosenzweig, suggests that the story which 12 Angry Men writer Reginald Rose claimed inspired him is actually a work of fiction.

item.title: Derby could lose Unesco title over plans to erect apartment block opposite historic silk mills
item.description: Derby could be next to lose its UNESCO heritage status amid plans to erect a 17-storey apartment block opposite an historic silk mill.

item.title: Pregnant Kathleen told to start chemo and lose her baby or amputate her leg... she didn't hesitate
item.description: Kathleen is the young mother who revealed that, having sacrificed her leg at London's National Orthopaedic Hospital so that she could save the life of her unborn baby, she is now terminally ill.

item.title: 'Truly scrumptious' meat and potato pie wins the British Pie Awards
item.description: A meat and potato pie was named winner of the prestigious British Pie Awards last night, beating a record number of vegan entries.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER HART reviews Titania McGrath: Mxnifesto at the Garrick Theatre
item.description: CHRISTOPHER HART: Titania McGrath is in fact the monstrous comic creation of satirist Andrew Doyle, and she began life as a mock Twitter account, commenting in her inimitably daft-woke way.

item.title: Lock, stock and two smoking grills! Guy Ritchie's £50,000 BBQ will premiere at Chelsea Flower Show
item.description: Guy Ritchie designed a luxury outdoor grill to entertain celebrity guests all year round at his Ashcombe House estate, near Salisbury, Wiltshire, that he bought with ex-wife Madonna.

item.title: Red Bull threatens small artisanal gin maker called Bullards because its name is 'too similar'
item.description: The Norwich-based firm received a letter from lawyers for Red Bull saying that there is a 'likelihood of confusion on behalf of the public' because both brand names 'include the term bull'.

item.title: Drinks giants are warned not to claim 'alcoholic water' is healthy or a diet option
item.description: The craze for these 'hard seltzers' has come from the US and British drinks brands and supermarkets have created their own versions, which are designed to appeal to women (file photo).

item.title: Five-star hotels in the UK: How do they get their top ratings?
item.description: Do you crave 'a substantial writing table with excellent free space'? That's one of the criteria for a five-star hotel. Here's everything you need to know about the science behind star ratings...

item.title: R. Kelly's talent manager testified he 'threatened' her that 'people come up missing'
item.description: A former employee of R. Kelly testified on Friday that he once threatened her to 'pick a team' warning her 'in these kinds of situations people come up missing.'

item.title: Met Police firearms officer, 36, is found guilty of perverting the course of justice
item.description: Richard Hammond, 36, was caught speeding over Tower Bridge as he drove home from a shift as a specialist firearms officer in his then-partner Vicky Courtis's car at 6am on August 26, 2018.

item.title: Family holidays in Europe: Take in the delights of German spa town Baden-Baden
item.description: Still hankering after a holiday? During her visit to the spa town of Baden-Baden, Fiona Hardcastle and her family race past pine trees on bobsleighs and soak in the Caracalla Spa.

item.title: Moment a model, 21, scrambled to save her son from their car after she was hijacked at knifepoint
item.description: Courtney Slater, 21, was lured into a trap after three men posing as a prospective buyer of designer sunglasses ambushed her and her boyfriend Brandon Higgins in Gorton, Manchester.

item.title: Grandfather builds mini Space X module with working doors for grandson who wants to be an astronaut
item.description: In a video taken by a family in Southampton, the white 'NASA Space X' module can be seen emitting steam when its 'thrusters' are activated, while a mini radar dish atop the shuttle rotates.
